alert.note: Alert for Clinton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 07 at 5:08PM EDT until July 07 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Clinton County in northern New York... * Until 715 PM EDT. * At 508 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, highways, town and secondary roads, as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Altona, Champlain, Miner Lake State Park, Sciota, Irona and Alder Bend. Additional heavy rainfall is moving into the warning area with the flash flood threat continuing through early evening. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
